title: How to find out if a person has registered their drone - Quora

response.answer_text: At present the UK CAA does not require registration of a UAV but airline pilots are pressing registration. Am not familiar with the detail but if you check with the FAA in the USA you will find out whether registrations are in the public domain , ie immediately available. If you get close enough to a registered drone you should see the ID number prominently displayed. Of course, it may happen that the pilot (your “person” may not be the registree. Which is more likely in the case of a child or a business-use drone.
If someone has registered their aircraft, drone or 747, it is searchable in the FAA registry here: Make / Model Inquiry Search by tail number, make, model or owner.
